Nightlight:

=E2=80=9CNot sure what to say about that  =E2=80=9Dreplied Nig=
hlight =E2=80=9CAll the Autobos and maximals think in others instead to the=
mselves in first place=E2=80=9D

From: Sandy Panico 
Sent: Saturday, July 2=
3, 2011 11:22 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: MEdic Bay




Nig=
htshift looks to Nightlight with a smile.  He could see that she was holdin=
g onto those memories as he suggested.  Gradually his damages were being re=
paired and he could now shift his position a little more easily.  Still his=
 servos were quite stiff from the side impact trauma he endured in his vehi=
cle form.  

" Master Yokitron did say that fate had strange ways of determ=
ining one's future and that no matter what we do, there's no way we can alt=
er it's course.  He was right.  No matter what happens now, fate is always =
gonna be the deciding factor on how things pan out from now on.  No one can=
 predict what's gonna happen, and whatever happens all we gotta do is roll =
with situations as they come up.  I think Tucson Prime's aware of that but =
I know he wants ta fight the odds.  Even before he got promoted, he's alway=
s been like that.  He wants freedom and peace for this planet and for us, a=
nd he's not gonna back down until he gets what he wants.  I only wish he'd =
save a little something for himself, he's always think'n of us before he th=
inks of himself.  I dunno about everyone else but, I don't wanna lose him. =
 He's one of the best friends, soldiers and friends we got on our side.  I =
just don't think he realizes that and he should."

He heaves a sigh while c=
ontinuing his repair session.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.=
 

On Jul 23, 2011, at 2:27 AM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...>=
 wrote:


    
  Nightlight:

  Nightlight smiled remembering all the happy=
 moments that she had shared with her husband and daughter

  From: Sandy P=
anico 
  Sent: Friday, July 22, 2011 4:38 PM
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
=
  Subject: Re: MEdic Bay




  Nightshift gives a smile.  

  " Hold onto t=
hose memories, they're priceless.  Noth'n compares ta the memories of good =
times and moments spent with the one ya love."

  Perpetually on the move a=
nd constantly busy. 

  On Jul 22, 2011, at 2:53 AM, Airshadow Nightstar <a=
irly2002@...> wrote:


      
    Nigtlight:

    =E2=80=9CYes, Lov=
e is so powerfull=E2=80=9Dsighed the femme whiule still she remembers all t=
he happy moments that she had spent with Rodimus even inside the Black Fort=
ress.

    From: Sandy Panico 
    Sent: Thursday, July 21, 2011 7:59 AM
  =
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
    Subject: Re: MEdic Bay




    Nightshift=
 smiles and gently holds Nightlight's hand.

    " And don't ever let anyon=
e take that away from ya.  Love is more valuable than energon and it lasts =
forever.  There's plenty of that here alright, lets hope we can hold inta t=
hat for a long time. "

    He shifts his position on the repair bench.

  =
  " This sure reminds me of Ratchet's med bay.  I must've ended up there so=
 many times that I lost count.  But it wasn't for stupid reasons, usually b=
ecause of freak ambush attempts by Decepticon speedsters.  I sure hated tho=
se guys, I wasn't as fast as they were and they knew it.  So of course they=
'd always chose me as their target.  Ratchet was aware of that, and he neve=
r got agitated when I came in.  But what was worse, I'd never hear the end =
of it from Sunstreaker and Sideswipe.  Slag, those two were always rank'n o=
n me.  But I tried ta ignore 'em.  Then one day, Ohh this is sweet, one day=
 it happened again and I wound back up in Ratchet's office. Tucson was mak'=
n a delivery of supplies before he got shot blind, and those two were pull'=
n their scrap on me.  Well, not only did he hear them, he saw them do'n it =
and slag, you didn't wanna be around Tucson that time, because he had the l=
ook of destruction in his eyes.  Now mind ya, they knew better not ta scrap=
 around with him because he'd slag 'em real good if they did.  All they had=
 ta do was look into his optics and they turned around and apologized ta me=
 without a single word outa Tucson's mouth.  After that, it never happened =
again."

    He sighs gently.

    " Happy ta say that there was never any =
ridicule ever said about anyone after that.  Optimus was glad about that, s=
o he let Tucson's temper slide somewhat.  It kept the speedsters in line an=
d guys like us, Hound, Trail Breaker, and Beach Comber were happy not ta ge=
t ranked on because of our lack of speed.  And definitely no one ever messe=
d with Ratchet.  Ohh no, that was considered taboo.  Maan I sure miss those=
 times."

    Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

    On Jul 21,=
 2011, at 3:11 AM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:


   =
     
      Nightlight:

      =E2=80=9CI=E2=80=99m very lucky to have Rodi=
mus in my life=E2=80=9Dsaid Nightlight =E2=80=9CThat and the birth of Elita=
 were the best things that happened in my life=E2=80=9D

      From: Sandy =
Panico 
      Sent: Tuesday, July 19, 2011 8:50 AM
      To: nbwrpg@yahoogr=
oups.com 
      Subject: Re: MEdic Bay




      Nightshift turns his head =
to Nightlight and reaches out to put a friendly hand on hers, to show his s=
upport.

      " It's okay, Bump knows what he's do'n.  In no time you'll b=
e back on your feet bust'n Predacon and Decepticon aft from here back ta Cy=
bertron.  And none of those jokers are gonna think twice about mess'n with =
you again. You got someth'n they don't have, and never will have, a good sp=
ark in you spark chamber."

      He then lies back in his repair chamber.
=

      " Rodimus is real lucky ta have someone like you in his life.  I nev=
er got the chance ta find someone back home.  Always too many things go'n o=
n and no time for relationships.  If I could tell the other Autobots someth=
'n I'd tell them ta enjoy the little things in life, the simple pleasures i=
t has ta offer.  Because if ya don't enjoy them while you're alive, you'll =
never get the chance again after you're gone."  

      Perpetually on the =
move and constantly busy. 

      On Jul 19, 2011, at 2:22 AM, Airshadow Ni=
ghtstar <airly2002@...> wrote:


          
        Nightlight:

  =
      "I can stand it"said firmly the femme "you can start when you conside=
r it 
        ready"

        -----Original Message----- 
        From: San=
dy Panico
        Sent: Monday, July 18, 2011 12:36 PM
        To: nbwrpg@y=
ahoogroups.com
        Subject: Re: MEdic Bay

        Nightshift nods casu=
ally to Bump.

        " Just keep me as is, without the dents and damage, =
a set of all weather, 
        all terrain tires, heavy duty if they're ava=
ilable and a launching system 
        for my alt mode so I can deploy gren=
ades as well as missile darts. Oh 
        yeah, new suspension system and =
a refresher paint job and rust prevention 
        treatment."

        He =
smiles.

        "Just kidd'n about the paint job thing."

        Perpetua=
lly on the move and constantly busy.

        On Jul 18, 2011, at 8:02 AM, =
Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

        >> <OLD>
        >=
>
        >> =E2=80=9CHow longer have I to wait to leave this place and get=
 my beast mode?=E2=80=9Dsaid
        >> Nightlight and then she looked at N=
ightshift and said =E2=80=9CI remember you,
        >> you were one of the =
maximals that were trapped in the throne room of
        >> Blackfortress=
=E2=80=9D
        >
        > <NEW>
        >
        > There was an unders=
tanding nod from BUMP, "We will have you out of
        > here just as soon=
 as we can." He walked over to NIGHTLIGHT and
        > activated a small v=
iewscreen next to her bed. "Fuzors are far more
        > difficult to do, =
but it is possible."
        >
        > There was a smile from the physist=
, "Remember, they were originaly
        > created from a mistake in the sc=
anners. But I think we have a way to
        > reproduce it controllably, a=
s long as you think your spark can handle
        > it."
        >
        =
>> <OLD>
        >>
        >> Nightshift looks to Nightlight with a friend=
ly smile. He was happy to 
        >> see
        >> that Nightlight rememb=
ered who he was. He had also been concerned for 
        >> her
        >> =
safety as were the others.
        >>
        >> " And I'd go through it ag=
ain too, if I had ta. It's real nice ta have 
        >> ya
        >> back=
. I just wish we knew what Hydras weakness is. The problem is that
        =
>> guy's got too many sets of eyes on 'em and in his alt form... Wait Thats=
 
        >> it,
        >> why didn't I think of this before? Nightlight, =
I get it now. I bet that 
        >> if
        >> he lost all visual capab=
ilities, Hydras would be severely compromised. 
        >> On
        >> th=
e other hand, Tucson lost the last fight because Hydras had 'em at a
      =
  >> disadvantage. But if Tucson took out all his visual circuitry, then he=

        >> would have the upper hand. Tucson's been blind a long time, it'=
s second
        >> nature ta him ta fight that way. But it's not for Hydra=
s. "
        >>
        >> He turns his head over to Bump.
        >>
     =
   >> " How would we go about knock'n out Hydras visual circuitry?"
       =
 >
        >
        > <NEW>
        >
        > There was a noncommital sh=
rug from BUMP, "Well a simple flash-bang
        > grenade could do it. It =
is basically a bright light followed by a
        > deafening noise." He sh=
rugged again, "I am not typically a weapons
        > engineer, but they sh=
ould be in the weapons stores."
        >
        > BUMP glanced at the rea=
douts displaying NIGHTLIGHT's vital signs,
        > nodding when everythin=
g looked good. He looked back at NIGHTSHIFT,
        > "Did you have anythi=
ng specific in mind?"
        >
        > (TAG)

f destruction in his eyes.  Now mind ya, they knew 
    better not ta =
scrap around with him because he'd slag 'em real good if they 
    did.&nbs=
p; All they had ta do was look into his optics and they turned 
    around =
and apologized ta me without a single word outa Tucson's mouth.  
    =
After that, it never happened again."</DIV>
    <DIV> </DIV>
    <DIV>=
He sighs gently.</DIV>
    <DIV> </DIV>
    <DIV>" Happy ta say that t=
here was never any ridicule ever said about anyone 
    after that.  O=
ptimus was glad about that, so he let Tucson's temper 
    slide somewhat.&=

    Hound, Trail Br=
eaker, and Beach Comber were happy not ta get ranked on 
    because of our=
 lack of speed.  And definitely no one ever messed with 
    Ratchet.&=
nbsp; Ohh no, that was considered taboo.  Maan I sure miss 
    those =
times."</DIV>
